```{r }
library(readr)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
# import files
netflix_titles <- read_csv("Data Science 1/New folder/data1/netflix_titles.csv")
amazon_titles <- read_csv("Data Science 1/New folder/data1/amazon_titles.csv")
apple_titles <- read_csv("Data Science 1/New folder/data1/apple_titles.csv")
hbo_titles <- read_csv("Data Science 1/New folder/data1/hbo_titles.csv")
disney_titles <- read_csv("Data Science 1/New folder/data1/disney_titles.csv")
# add column for streaming platform
netflix_titles = netflix_titles %>% mutate(platform = 'Netflix')
amazon_titles = amazon_titles %>% mutate(platform = 'Amazon')
apple_titles = apple_titles %>% mutate(platform = 'Apple TV')
hbo_titles = hbo_titles %>% mutate(platform = 'HBO Max')
disney_titles = disney_titles %>% mutate(platform = 'Disney')
# combine all datasets to one
all_titles = full_join(netflix_titles, amazon_titles)
all_titles = full_join(all_titles, apple_titles)
all_titles = full_join(all_titles, disney_titles)
all_titles = full_join(all_titles, hbo_titles)
# remove unwanted data 'id', and 'imdb_id'
#reorganize columns
all_titles = all_titles %>% subset(select = -c(id, imdb_id))
all_titles = all_titles %>% select(platform, everything())
#split data set bewtween MOVIE and SHOW
all_movies = all_titles %>% filter(type == 'MOVIE')
all_shows = all_titles %>% filter(type == 'SHOW')
```
